result.execSummary:
The defendant Salvadore Rivas was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500) [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).
  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Salvadore Rivas in court with attorney Matthew Adrian Lamke.  Alex T. Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Defendant prepared to enter change of plea.  Hearing proceeded.  Negotiations set forth by the state.

As to Counts 1 and 3:  Defendant changes his plea to GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty.   Defendant advised that if not a United States Citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found that defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant guilty and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.

Sentencing proceeded. Statements by parties.  
As to Count 1:  Defendant ordered to serve 4 months in the House of Correction consecutive to Count 2 with credit of 0 days time served.  Court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on probation for 24 months.

As to Count 3:  Defendant ordered to serve 9 months in the House of Correction.  Court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on probation for 24 months.

Conditions of Probation:  
*Alcohol and drug assessment and comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.
*Maintain absolute sobriety.  No illegal drugs.
*No Contact with Target in West Milwaukee and co-defendant, Sylvia H. 
*Maintain full time employment and/or school.
*Defendant to pay all costs and surcharges during period of probation.  If unpaid a civil judgment will be ordered filed against the defendant.

Defendant Salvadore Rivas in court with attorney Matthew Adrian Lamke.  Alex T. Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case calendared for plea/sentencing. Court granted Defense's motion to adjourn to allow for the defendant's discharge from a current sentence.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for December 10, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Salvadore Rivas in court with attorney Matthew Adrian Lamke via telephone. Defense requests an adjourned Plea and Sentencing date. Court grants defense request. Case adjourned to branch 45.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 5, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant Salvadore Rivas in court with attorney Matthew Adrian Lamke.  Alex T. Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 28, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Salvadore Rivas in court with attorney Matthew Adrian Lamke.  Alex T. Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case in court for bail/bond hearing however, the defendant is no longer in custody. Defense requested a plea and sentencing date. Case adjourned to Branch 23.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 22, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Matthew Adrian Lamke in court, defendant Salvadore Rivas not in court, in custody.  Sarah McNutt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Defendant's appearance waived.  Case scheduled for plea/sentencing hearing.  Defense counsel requests a bail/bond hearing date.  Parties are notified that effective August 3, 2015 this case will be reassigned per rotation to Judge Lindsey Grady, Branch 23 in Courthouse room 515.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for August 24, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Salvadore Rivas in court with attorney Matthew Adrian Lamke.  Elizabeth Longo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
State has turned over an offer and discovery.  Defense requests a plea and sentencing date. Court ordered case adjourned to Branch 46.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 24, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Scheduling conference scheduled for 05-13-2015 at 08:30 am.
Court ordered bench warrant withdrawn.  Recall issued.

Defendant Salvadore Rivas in court.  Alyssa M. Schaller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
OCCR Tape #15-082

Statements to the Court.  Case is adjourned for return on bench warrant in Branch 46.
Defendant is advised that all conditions of bail remain as previously set, including the No Contact Order.
Clerk:  jms
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE BENCH  WARRANT.

Attorney Matthew Adrian Lamke in court.  Catelin Ringersma appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Case scheduled for pretrial conference.  The defendant having failed to appear, the court ordered a bench warrant to issue.  Court does not forfeit bail at this time.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with any Target Stores AND Sylvia H.
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Salvadore Rivas in court.  Patrick J Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant advised that this case is assigned to Reserve Judge, Branch 46.
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.   Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance.  Defendant IS Public Defender eligible.  Defendant is ordered to provide the public defender's office with the next court date.  The case is adjourned to Br. 46 for a Pretrial Conference.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for April 22, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Summons mailed.  Defendant is Out-of-Custody. Court appearance in Out-Of-Custody Court, Room 221 Safety Building on 4-15-2015 at 1:30pm
